New Records: Rohit Sharma became the first man to five T20I hundreds
Key Match Events: The match went to two Super Overs after India and Afghanistan tied the match in regular play
Rohit Sharma hit two sixes in the first Super Over and a six in the second Super Over to win the match
Gulbadin Naib's unbeaten 55 took the contest to Super Over
Washington Sundar bowled slow and away from the batters' reach to dismiss Nabi
Mukesh Kumar kept going for wide ones in the 20th over of Afghanistan's innings, but got away with two hittable balls in the end
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma starred again in the Super Overs to wrap up India's clean sweep
Rohit Sharma was allowed to come back again and hit a six in the second Super Over too
India's spinners, Kuldeep Yadav and Ravi Bishnoi, went flatter and quicker when under the pump
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was a dead rubber of a bilateral series, but things happened that you don't often see
Nabi and Rahmanullah Gurbaz ran overthrows off the body on the last ball of the first Super Over

Rohit, the non-striker, walked off to allow Rinku to take up the running duties, but Yashasvi Jaiswal's bottom edge went only as far as the wicketkeeper, and the second tie necessitated another Super Over
Others: The pitch started off tacky, and Fareed and Azmatullah Omarzai made full use of the variable pace and movement out of the surface
Qais Ahmad extracted grip and turn from the same surface later, and even extracted an lbw decision against Rinku, but on review, UltraEdge recorded a faint inside edge
